task.maid_restaurant.cook.desc: Maid will cook when receiving cook requests
task.maid_restaurant.waiter.desc: Maid will serve meals to selected tables when receiving serve requests
gui.maid_restaurant.cook_request.stockin: Stocking Mode:Cook when target tables has any empty slot.
Stocking Mode:Cook when target tables has enough empty slots.
config.maid_restaurant.server.give_patch: Give the Your Maid Serves! book item for player first join
patchouli.maid_restaurant.book.name: Your Maid Serves!
patchouli.maid_restaurant.book.categorie: Management Basics
The knowledge needed to become a qualified restaurant manager.
Cooking Support
Understand the cooking methods supported by the Cook Maid and corresponding key points.
Cook Maid

$(#055864)Cook$() is a task added by this mod for maids. A maid assigned to the cook task is called a $(#055864)Cook Maid$(). $(br2)A Cook Maid maintains a $(#055864)Cook Request$() queue with a maximum length of 7. $(br2)Hold a $(l:maid_restaurant:basic_management/order_menu)$(#055864)Restaurant Menu$()$() and right-click a Cook Maid to view her cook request queue, cancel requests, modify request properties,

and set whether the Cook Maid accepts new cook requests. $(br2)When the queue is empty, the Cook Maid remains idle and does not move on her own. $(br)Or else, the Cook Maid checks for the required ingredients and corresponding cooking blocks. $(br2)If ingredients are insufficient, the maid will attempt to move to nearby $(l:maid_restaurant:basic_management/maid_storage)$(#055864)Maid Storage$()$() and retrieve the needed ingredients.

If ingredients are sufficient, the Cook Maid will search for nearby unoccupied cooking blocks, and sit/stand (configurable) on a $(#055864)Cooking Stool$() one block lower than the cooking block, then start cooking. $(br2)After cooking, the Cook Maid sends a $(#055864)Serve Request$() to the $(#055864)Serve Request Bus$() based on the completed cooking request.

The bus continuously broadcasts the request within a spherical range of 50 blocks centered on the Cook Maid, until any $(l:maid_restaurant:basic_management/waiter_maid)$(#055864)Waiter Maid$()$() within range accepts the serve request.
Maid Storage

In the restaurant, container blocks that can be interacted with by maids are called $(#055864)Maid Storage$(). $(br2)A $(l:maid_restaurant:basic_management/cook_maid)$(#055864)Cook Maid$()$() can retrieve ingredients required for cooking from the Maid Storage. $(br2)A $(l:maid_restaurant:basic_management/waiter_maid)$(#055864)Waiter Maid$()$() can store the cooked dishes into the Maid Storage.

Currently, Maid Storage includes: $(br2)Vanilla $(#055864)Chest$(), $(#055864)Barrel$() $(br2)Kaleidoscope Cookery's $(#055864)Table$(), $(#055864)Fruit Basket$() $(br2)Create's $(#055864)Depot$(), $(#055864)Belt$(), $(#055864)Item Vault$()
Order Menu
To start running a restaurant, you first need a $(#055864)Order Menu$(). $(br2)You can craft it on a crafting table using a $(#055864)Recipe Item$() and a $(#055864)Feather$().
This is where it all begins.
Send Order

To send a cooking order, first right-click with a $(l:maid_restaurant:basic_management/order_menu)$(#055864)Order Menu$()$() to select a table. $(br)After the order is completed, a $(l:maid_restaurant:basic_management/waiter_maid)$(#055864)Waiter Maid$()$() will deliver the finished dish to the selected table. $(br2)All $(l:maid_restaurant:basic_management/maid_storage)$(#055864)Maid Storage$()$() can be selected as the target table. $(br2)Blocks with the $(#055864)#serve_blockmeal_block$() tag and an unobstructed block above

them can also be selected as the target table. $(br2)When a table is selected, right-clicking on air with the Order Menu opens the ordering GUI. $(br2)The main UI area displays 2 columns of 14 recipes of the current type per page, supporting mouse wheel scrolling. $(br)You can use the search bar above to filter recipes by the $(#055864)display name$() and $(#055864)registry name$() of the recipe result.

On the horizontal bar at the bottom of the UI, all supported recipe types are displayed, allowing you to switch the recipe type shown in the main area. $(br)Mouse wheel scrolling is also supported here. $(br2)The left side of the UI displays the selected recipes. Here you can set order properties ($(#055864)Loop$(), $(#055864)Auto-restock$()...), cancel orders, and confirm orders. You can also use the mouse wheel to adjust the requested quantity.

After confirming the order is correct, click the âˆš at the bottom left to confirm the order. $(br2)Thus, the system will package the order and the selected table as a $(#055864)Cook Request$() and send it to the $(#055864)Cook Request Bus$(). $(br2)The bus continuously broadcasts the request within a spherical range of 50 blocks centered on the first selected table, until any $(l:maid_restaurant:basic_management/cook_maid)$(#055864)Cook Maid$()$()
within range accepts the cook request.
Waiter Maid

$(#055864)Waiter$() is a task added by this mod for maids. A maid assigned to the waiter task is called a $(#055864)Waiter Maid$(). $(br2)A Waiter Maid maintains a $(#055864)Serve Request$() queue with a maximum length of 4. $(br2)Hold a $(l:maid_restaurant:basic_management/order_menu)$(#055864)Restaurant Menu$()$() and right-click a Waiter Maid to view her serve request queue and cancel requests as needed.

When the queue is empty, the Waiter Maid remains idle and does not move on her own. $(br)If the queue is not empty, the Waiter Maid checks whether she has enough of the specified dishes in her inventory. $(br2)If she lacks the required dishes, she will go to the $(l:maid_restaurant:basic_management/cook_maid)$(#055864)Cook Maid$()$() who issued the serve request and attempt to obtain the needed dishes from the Cook Maid.

Then, the Waiter Maid will go to the nearest valid table and attempt to serve the dish: $(li2)If the target has the $(#055864)#serve_blockmeal_block$() tag and the block above it is unobstructed, the maid will prioritize placing the dish as a block$() $(li2)Otherwise, she will put the dish into the target $(l:maid_restaurant:basic_management/maid_storage)$(#055864)Maid Storage$()$() as an item. $(br2)If none of the selected tables can be served, the Waiter Maid will drop the remaining dishes near the last table.
Stockpot

$(li2)$(#055864)Ingredients$(): ingredients + container$()$(br)$(li2)$(#055864)Kitchenware$(): stockpot lid$()$(br)$(li2)$(#055864)Special Note$(): If the maid has more than $(#055864)2$() water buckets in her inventory, adding water soup base does not consume a water bucket.$()
Pot

$(li2)$(#055864)Ingredients$(): ingredients (+ container)$()$(br)$(li2)$(#055864)Kitchenware$(): Kitchen Shovel$()$(br)$(li2)$(#055864)Special Note$(): Currently, maids cannot obtain oil from oil pots or enamel basins.$()
Steamer
$(li2)$(#055864)Ingredients$(): ingredients$()$(br)$(li2)$(#055864)Kitchenware$(): None$()$(br)$(li2)$(#055864)Special Note$(): Supports steamers up to 4 blocks high.$()
Cooking Pot
$(li2)$(#055864)Ingredients$(): ingredients (+ container)$()$(br)$(li2)$(#055864)Kitchenware$(): None$()$(br)$(li2)$(#055864)Special Note$(): None$()
Oven

$(li2)$(#055864)Ingredients$(): ingredients$()$(br)$(li2)$(#055864)Kitchenware$(): None$()$(br)$(li2)$(#055864)Special Note$(): The maid will automatically adjust the oven temperature to the perfect level.$()
Blender
$(li2)$(#055864)Ingredients$(): ingredients (+ container)$()$(br)$(li2)$(#055864)Kitchenware$(): None$()$(br)$(li2)$(#055864)Special Note$(): None$()
Toaster
$(li2)$(#055864)Ingredients$(): ingredients$()$(br)$(li2)$(#055864)Kitchenware$(): None$()$(br)$(li2)$(#055864)Special Note$(): The toaster supports all campfire recipes.$()
Drink Cup

$(li2)$(#055864)Ingredients$(): ingredients + glass beverage cup$()$(br)$(li2)$(#055864)Cookware$(): None$()$(br)$(li2)$(#055864)Special Note$(): The maid will place a drink cup above the cupboard, then prepare the drink.$()
